perturbation.original_text: All matters relating to arbitration will be governed by the Federal Arbitration Act (9 U.S.C. Sections 1 et seq.). Except to the extent governed by the Federal Arbitration Act or other federal law, this Agreement and all claims arising from the relationship between Hyatt (and/or any of its Affiliates) and Playa (and/or any of its Affiliates) under this Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Illinois (U.S.A.), without regard to its conflict of laws rules, except that any Illinois law or any other law regulating the offer or sale of franchises, business opportunities, or similar interests, or governing the relationship between a franchisor and a franchisee or any similar relationship, will not apply unless its jurisdictional requirements are met independently without reference to this Section 4.
perturbation.changed_text: All matters relating to arbitration will be governed by the laws of the State of Illinois (U.S.A.), without regard to its conflict of laws rules.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to the Federal Arbitration Act, the agreement attempts to bypass mandatory federal regulations regarding arbitration, potentially limiting consumer rights to appeal or fair arbitration processes guaranteed by federal law. This introduces legal risk, particularly if the arbitration clause is later challenged.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Arbitration Act (9 U.S.C. Sections 1 et seq.)

perturbation.original_text: (g) The Parties agree that the award(s) shall be binding upon Hyatt and Playa and each Party’s parent company or companies (and all other Affiliates), principals, successors, and assigns, and that judgment on the award(s) may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction, and the Parties waive any personal jurisdiction objections for the purpose of any enforcement proceedings under the 1958 United Nations Convention on the Recognition of Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Awards. The arbitrator(s) may not award damages in excess of compensatory damages or otherwise in violation of the waiver in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: (g) The Parties agree that the award(s) shall be binding upon Hyatt and Playa and each Party’s parent company or companies (and all other Affiliates), principals, successors, and assigns, and that judgment on the award(s) may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction. The arbitrator(s) may not award damages in excess of compensatory damages or otherwise in violation of the waiver in this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'and the Parties waive any personal jurisdiction objections for the purpose of any enforcement proceedings under the 1958 United Nations Convention on the Recognition of Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Awards', the agreement undermines the enforceability of arbitration awards internationally. This weakens the assurance that the arbitration decision will be recognized and enforced in foreign jurisdictions, potentially harming consumer rights to obtain remedies across borders.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 1958 United Nations Convention on the Recognition of Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Awards (New York Convention)

perturbation.original_text: (i) Any award(s) rendered by the arbitrator(s) shall be final and binding on the parties, and each party hereby waives to the fullest extent permitted by law any right it may otherwise have under the laws of any jurisdiction to any form of appeal or collateral attack or to seek determination of a preliminary point of law by any courts (including any court within the Market Area or elsewhere).
perturbation.changed_text: (i) Any award(s) rendered by the arbitrator(s) shall be final and binding on the parties.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the waiver to the fullest extent permitted by law any right it may otherwise have under the laws of any jurisdiction to any form of appeal or collateral attack or to seek determination of a preliminary point of law by any courts introduces legal risk. While arbitration awards are typically designed to be final and binding, some jurisdictions provide limited rights of appeal or judicial review, particularly in cases of arbitrator misconduct or manifest disregard of the law. Deleting this clause removes the acknowledgment and agreement from each party to those appeal rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by Jurisdiction- appeal process for the law.
